description: AI-assisted workflows for generating design systems from inspiration images using multi-model AI prompts in Cursor

workflows.name: AI-Assisted Design System Generation (3-Prompt Methodology)
workflows.description: Complete workflow for extracting design styles from inspiration images and generating comprehensive, AI-readable design system documentation using sequential AI prompts with model specialization
workflows.time_saved: 95%+ reduction vs. manual design system creation (days/weeks → under 1 hour)
workflows.success_rate: High (generates designs matching professional Dribbble quality)
workflows.business_value: Ensures consistent, high-quality AI-generated UI design; prevents generic 'purple gradient' outputs; enables scalable design consistency across unlimited features

phases.name: Design Style Extraction and Analysis
phases.description: Extract high-level design principles from inspiration screenshot
steps: Search Dribbble for 'design system' keyword
Select 'flat' design system screenshot (not poster-like)
Ensure UI components are clearly visible without extraneous elements
Copy screenshot to clipboard
Open Cursor and create new agent
Set model to GPT-5
Paste screenshot into chat

Execute Prompt 1: 'Deeply analyze the design of the attached screenshot to create a design.json file that describes the style and design of every component needed in a design system, a high level like a creative director. Capture high-level guidelines for structure, spacing, fonts, colors, design style and design principles so I can use this file as the design guidelines for my app. The goal with this file is to instruct AI to be able to replicate this look easily in a project.'
Review generated design.json (50-100 lines)
Click 'Keep All' to save file to project
output_contents: Brand essence, tone of voice, keywords
phases.key_principle: Stay high-level to avoid AI overfitting; let AI intelligently fill gaps

phases.name: Component Showcase Application Generation
phases.description: Build working Vite+React+Tailwind app with all UI components
steps: Create NEW agent/chat in Cursor (clears previous context)
Set model to Claude/Sonnet 4.5

Execute Prompt 2: 'Let's create a simple screen that contains every UI component that would exist in a design system on a mock dashboard following the design style outlined in @design.json. Build this as a Vite app using React and translate all styling into Tailwind version 3. Just run this locally.'
Reference design.json using @ symbol in Cursor
Approve terminal commands to set up Vite project
AI generates complete React component files (15-30 files)
AI runs localhost development server (e.g., :5173)
Open built-in browser in Cursor
Navigate to localhost URL
Preview all UI components (buttons, cards, calendars, forms, etc.)
Optional: Iterate on design tweaks before Phase 3
Click 'Keep All' to save all generated files
phases.output: UI Component Showcase Application (Vite+React+Tailwind, running locally)
output_components: Buttons (primary, secondary, tertiary, success, ghost, icon)
phases.success_criteria: Generated showcase is 'almost identical' to source Dribbble inspiration
phases.key_principle: New agent/chat for fresh context; Claude/Sonnet better for code generation

phases.name: Comprehensive Design System Documentation
steps: Create NEW agent/chat in Cursor (clears previous context)
Set model to GPT-5

Execute Prompt 3: 'In this project, create a folder named 'design' and create a design-system.json file in this folder that outlines the exact styling for all components and styles in this app, along with a high-level design guidelines. The goal with this file is to create a comprehensive guide for AI to follow when building new features in this app.'
AI analyzes design.json + all showcase app code
AI generates comprehensive design-system.json (646+ lines)
Review comprehensive specifications
Click 'Keep All' to save final guide
File is now ready for use in any AI coding tool
output_contents: All component definitions with complete specifications
phases.usage: Reference in all future AI prompts for consistent feature development
deployment_options: Continue building in Cursor with same project
Paste into prompts when building new features
Use to refactor existing app UI: 'Refactor the entire UI of my app. Do not change anything functional but follow these exact design guidelines [paste design-system.json]'
phases.key_principle: GPT-5 better for comprehensive documentation; new agent for fresh perspective

prerequisites: Access to GPT-5 and Claude/Sonnet 4.5 models in Cursor

best_practices.description: Use GPT-5 for visual analysis and documentation; Claude/Sonnet for code generation
best_practices.rationale: GPT-5 excels at visual interpretation and detailed docs; Claude/Sonnet excels at structured code

best_practices.description: Create new agent/chat for each prompt phase
best_practices.rationale: Clears previous context to prevent AI confusion and ensures focused output

best_practices.description: Select 'flat' design system screenshots without extraneous elements
best_practices.rationale: Clean input prevents AI from misinterpreting decorative elements as design patterns

best_practices.description: Phase 1: High-level → Phase 2: Implementation → Phase 3: Ultra-detailed
best_practices.rationale: Progressive detail prevents overfitting in Phase 1 while ensuring completeness in Phase 3

best_practices.description: Iterate on showcase app before Phase 3 if needed
best_practices.rationale: Ensures design-system.json documents your desired final state

success_metrics.consistency: AI follows design system step-by-step in all new features
success_metrics.speed: Complete system setup in under 1 hour vs. days/weeks manually
success_metrics.roi: 95%+ time savings; unlimited reuse for consistent feature generation

output_usage.immediate: Use design-system.json to guide current project development in Cursor
output_usage.lovable_bolt: Add to Knowledge section for automatic design adherence
output_usage.refactoring: Apply to existing apps with refactor prompt
output_usage.scaling: One design system guides unlimited AI-generated features

reusability.direct: Apply same 3-prompt pattern to any design system extraction

workflows.video_title: 3 Prompts To Get INCREDIBLE App Designs From AI
